sub_title: Founding Director at RADIUS, center for contemporary art and ecology.
summary: Niekolaas Johannes Lekkerkerk (NL) works as a curator and writer in the fields of art and ecology. He founded RADIUS, center for contemporary art and ecology in Delft (2021) and The Office for Curating (2012), and was director of the non-profit art institution A Tale of A Tub in Rotterdam between 2019 and 2021. Central to Lekkerkerk’s work are social and political discourses revolving around daily living and working practices, cultural norms, and ideologies. He particularly focuses on debates concerning the Anthropocene, ecology and climate, post-humanism, and the increasing entanglement between nature and culture. Lekkerkerk published The Standard Book of Noun-Verb Exhibition Grammar (Onomatopee, 2018) and Bestiary of Corona Animals (Onomatopee, 2020). In 2012 he received the inaugural Demergon Curatorial Award, and in 2014 he was the beneficiary of the Akbank Sanat International Curator Competition.

awards.title: Nogueras Blanchard Curatorial Open Call
awards.description:
NoguerasBlanchard is dedicated to developing a cross-disciplinary international gallery programme, reflecting a variety of conceptually-motivated positions and practices. The gallery´s main goal is to engage in a long-term commitment with the careers of its artists and to be highly involved in the production of works as well as off-site projects. We are assisting with proposals, raising funds to produce films, biennial projects or catalogues while working in close alliance with international galleries and institutions. 
In 2011 we launched the first international Curatorial Open Call where we dedicate a yearly exhibition to emerging curatorial practices. Other initiatives to engage the local public include a book club and the 'Kitchen Talks', a series of informal talks in the gallery kitchen, where we invite artists, art critics, curators and other cultural agents. NoguerasBlanchard opened its first space in Barcelona in June 2004 and this year has opened a second exhibition space in Madrid.

profile_positions.description: RADIUS is a center for contemporary art and ecology. We are located in the city of Delft and stationed in the pump house and water basin belonging to the Delft water tower, a historical monument and architectural landmark. With five hundred square meters of subterranean exhibition space, our program is dedicated to the intersection of art and science, with an emphasis on climate, ecology and the living environment.
profile_positions.title: Founding Director

profile_positions.description: The Office for Curating is the generic name for a curatorial agency and research office, formalised and established in 2012 by Niekolaas Johannes Lekkerkerk, and currently active in and from Rotterdam, The Netherlands. The Office for Curating acts as an assembler of a growing programme of exhibitions (including publications, texts, and speech acts) and as a support structure for initiating exhibitions as a rise to the occasion – presented in different shapes and configurations, along different temporal structures and rhythms, as hosted by different institutions. The Office for Curating takes a strong interest in curatorial practice as a tool for thinking contemporary society through artistic practices.
profile_positions.title: Curator and Writer

profile_positions.description:
A Tale of a Tub is a non-profit institution for contemporary art and culture. The program is centered around questions of how art can contribute to our understanding of present-day social, political, and ecological issues. Our exhibition program is framed through intersectional ecological thinking, in which subjects related to nature, climate, ecology and the shared living environment, gender, feminism and decolonization, as well as the increasing influence of digital infrastructures and advanced-capitalist and neoliberal systems and governments intertwine with one another. We want to make these naturecultures and complexities tangible and accessible for our publics, and thereby endorse the essential importance of educational and discursive actions and events as an integral dimension of our programming. From the former bathhouse at the heart of the monumental Justus van Effen complex, A Tale of a Tub offers its space, infrastructure and resources to artists, curators and practitioners from different fields of inquiry to develop newly commissioned artistic productions, reflecting on complex societal issues and debates as to further strengthen and enrich our daily living and working practices, often based on long term-research and interdisciplinary dialogue.

A Tale of a Tub was founded in 2014 by Nathanja van Dijk and Suzanne Wallinga and was directed in partnership with Fleur van Muiswinkel and Carolyn Drake Kandiyoti. From September 2019 onwards, A Tale of a Tub is directed by Julia Geerlings and Niekolaas Johannes Lekkerkerk.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description: POPPOSITIONS was established in 2012 as a counterpoint to mainstream art fairs, and has grown as the leading fair offering an alternative market for contemporary art. In the pas six years, POPPOSITIONS has been dealing with questions of artistic agency, self-organisation, cynicism and criticality in order to shape its profile within the cultural, artistic and economic landscape. Seeking for critical dialogues beyond the generic white space, POPPOSITIONS presents emerging artists in a site-specific context, occupying a different venue each year. For the editions of 2017, 2018 and 2019—respectively titled Don’t Agonize, Organize!, In Watermelon Sugar, and Capital of Woke—I have been involved as the curator and artistic director of the POPPOSITIONS assembly.
profile_positions.title: Artistic Director

profile_positions.description: For the duration of one year I will be guiding and supporting the Master of Research in Art and Design students of the St. Lucas School of Art towards their final exhibition. The programme is devised of intensive studio visits and a number of workshops regarding curatorial discourses and methodologies. The position will culminate in curating the collective group exhibition Tradition Doesn’t Graduate, taking place at Komplot in Brussels during May and June 2016.
profile_positions.title: Guest-Curator and Tutor

profile_positions.description:
As Curatorial Fellow for TENT, I curated the group exhibition The Museum of Unconditional Surrender (May-July 2015), the solo exhibition All Begins with A by Janneke van der Putten
(July-September 2015), and the group exhibition Spending Quality Time With My Quantified Self (February-April 2016). Furthermore, I provided support for and made contributions to the development and implementation of the year programme, its coinciding public and educational events.
profile_positions.title: Curatorial Fellow

profile_positions.description: The C.o.C.A. Commission is an incentive award for young artists living in The Netherlands. Taking the shape of a bursary, the C.o.C.A. Commission aims to stimulate and support the development of the respective artist's practice, which culminates in an exhibition project and presentation coinciding with the Art Rotterdam art fair. As curator of the C.o.C.A. Commission I shortlisted a number of artists, and worked together with artist Paul Geelen on his exhibition entitled Sliding under Traces.
profile_positions.title: Curator C.o.C.A. Commission 2015

profile_positions.description:
Followup is the title for a Dutch-German collaboration, for which one Dutch and one German curator will be given the opportunity to dedicate half a year to the development of an exhibition programme in different museums and art spaces in the border region.

The Mondriaan Fund offers and supports this practice-oriented foreign residency for a young Dutch curator up to the age of thirty-five. In that, a collaboration has been established with Schloss Ringenberg in Germany. With the residency, the Fund aims to provide an opportunity for young curators to reflect and expand on their practices in a different environment and culture. The jury for this residency has appointed Niekolaas Johannes Lekkerkerk as the curator-in-residence for the period of July to December 2014.

The Ringenberg Biennale, Schloss Ringenberg, Hamminkeln
